context: The word 'mõnus' is an adjective in Estonian that describes something as pleasant, nice, or delightful. It can be used to describe experiences, food, weather, or things that bring enjoyment. The word changes form depending on the case and number of the noun it modifies - in the examples shown: 'mõnus' (nominative singular), 'mõnusat' (partitive singular), and 'mõnused' (nominative plural).
